qahramon

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • qahramon.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Hero, Monster

    public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class of characters involving a name, an amount of hitpoints, a maximum amount of hitpoints and anchors.
    Version:
    1.0 - 2019
    Author:
    Robin Bruneel, Jean-Louis Carron, Edward Wiels
    Invariants:
  • Each character must have proper items anchored.
        hasProperItems()
  • Each character must have a valid name.
        canHaveAsName(getName())
  • Each character must have a valid amount of hitpoints.
        canHaveAsHitpoints(getHitpoints())
  • Each character must have a valid maximum amount of hitpoints.
        isValidMaxHitpoints(getMaxHitpoints())
  • Each character must have a valid number of anchors.
        isValidNumberOfAnchors(getNumberOfAnchors())

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        @Basic
public java.lang.String getName()
        Return the character's name.
        Returns:
        Return the character's name.

      • canHaveAsName

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsName(java.lang.String name)
        Check whether the name is valid.
        Returns:
        Return true when the name starts with a capital and only contains letters, spaces and apostrophes.
            name != null && name.matches("[A-Z][A-Za-z' ]*")

      • changeName

        public void changeName(java.lang.String name)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Change the name to the given name when valid.
        Parameters:
        name - the new name
        Postcondition:
        The name is set to the given name.
            new.getName() == name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this error when the given name is not valid. | !canHaveAsName(name)

      • getHitpoints

        @Basic
public int getHitpoints()
        Return the current amount of hitpoints.
        Returns:
        Return the current amount of hitpoints.

      • canHaveAsHitpoints

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsHitpoints(int hitpoints)
        Check whether the player can have the given amount of hitpoints.
        Parameters:
        hitpoints - the amount of hitpoints to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the character can have the amount of hitpoints. Return false otherwise.
            hitpoints >= 0 && (isFighting() || MathHelper.isPrime(hitpoints) || hitpoints == 0)

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(int hitpoints)
        Remove hitpoints from the character.
        Parameters:
        hitpoints - the amount of hitpoints to be taken
        Precondition:
        The given amount of hitpoints must be a positive amount.
            hitpoints >= 0
        Postconditions:
      • Remove the given amount of hitpoints or sets it to zero when the new amount of hitpoints would be negative.
            new.getHitpoints() == Math.max(0, getHitpoints()-hitpoints)
      • When the character takes damage, isFighting is set to true. When the character dies isFighting is set to false.
            new.isFighting() || new.isDead()

      • getMaxHitpoints

        @Basic
public int getMaxHitpoints()
        Return the maximum amount of hitpoints.
        Returns:
        Return the maximum amount of hitpoints.

      • isValidMaxHitpoints

        public static boolean isValidMaxHitpoints(int hitpoints)
        Check whether the player can have the maximum amount of hitpoints.
        Parameters:
        hitpoints - the maximum amount of hitpoints to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the character can have the maximum amount of hitpoints. Return false otherwise.
            hitpoints > 0 && MathHelper.isPrime(hitpoints)

      • increaseMaxHitpoints

        public void increaseMaxHitpoints(int hitpoints)
        Increase the maximum amount of hitpoints.
        Parameters:
        hitpoints - the new amount of maximum hitpoints
        Preconditions:
      • The given amount of hitpoints must be a positive amount.
            hitpoints >= 0
      • The new amount of maximum hitpoints must be valid.
            isValidMaxHitpoints(this.getMaxHitpoints() + hitpoints)
        • Postcondition:
        Increase the amount of maximum hitpoints with the given amount.
            new.getMaxHitpoints() == this.getMaxHitpoints() + hitpoints

      • lowerMaxHitpoints

        public void lowerMaxHitpoints(int hitpoints)
        Lower the maximum amount of hitpoints.
        Parameters:
        hitpoints - the new amount of maximum hitpoints
        Preconditions:
      • The given amount of hitpoints must be a positive amount.
            hitpoints >= 0
      • the new amount of maximum hitpoints must be valid
            isValidMaxHitpoints(this.getMaxHitpoints() - hitpoints)
        • Postconditions:
      • Lower the amount of maximum hitpoints with the given amount.
            new.getMaxHitpoints() == this.getMaxHitpoints() - hitpoints
      • When the new amount of maximum hitpoints is lower than the current value of hitpoints, the current value of hitpoints is set to the maximum amount of hitpoints.
            if (getHitpoints() > getMaxHitpoints()) then new.getHitpoints() == getMaxHitpoints()

      • isFighting

        @Basic
public boolean isFighting()
        Return the current fighting state of this character.
        Returns:
        Return the current fighting state of this character.

      • isDead

        @Raw
public boolean isDead()
        Check whether this character is dead.
        Returns:
        Return true when this character is dead.
            result == getHitpoints() == 0

      • getProtection

        public abstract int getProtection()
        Return the protection of the character.
        Returns:
        Return the protection of the current character.

      • getDamage

        public abstract int getDamage()
        Return the damage of the character.
        Returns:
        Return the damage of the current character.

      • getItemAt

        @Basic
public Item getItemAt(int anchorId)
        Return the item at the given anchorId.
        Parameters:
        anchorId - the anchorId of the item
        Returns:
        Return the item at the given anchorId.

      • getNbItems

        @Basic
public int getNbItems()
        Return the number of anchored items.
        Returns:
        Return the number of anchored items.

      • canHaveAsItemAt

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsItemAt(int anchorId,
                                    Item item)
        Check whether the given item can be equipped in the given slot.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be checked
        Returns:
        Return false when this character is dead. Return false when this item is terminated. Return false when the anchor id is lower than 0 and higher than the maximum anchors allowed. Return false when the given item can't have this character Return true when the item is owned by this player or the item is on the ground and able to be picked up. Return false otherwise.
            result == (anchorId >= 0 && anchorId < getNumberOfAnchors()) && (item.getHolder == this)
             && (item.canHaveAsCharacter(this))
             || (item.getHolder() == null && canPickUp(item)))

      • hasAnchored

        @Raw
public boolean hasAnchored(Item item)
        Check whether this character has the given item anchored.
        Returns:
        Return true when this character has the given item anchored. Return false otherwise.
            for some (Item itemAt : getAnchoredItems())
             itemAt == item

      • equip

        public void equip(int anchorId,
                  Item item)
           throws DeadException
        Equip item from own inventory or from ground, on the given slot.
        Parameters:
        anchorId - the id of the anchor to be set
        item - the item to be equipped
        Postconditions:
      • When this item cannot be equipped, nothing happens (total programming).
            !(canHaveAsItemAt())
      • When equipped the item at the given id will be set to the given item.
            getItemAt(anchorId) == item
        • Effects:
      • Unequip the item in that slot if not null.
            unequip(anchorId)
      • When equipped the anchor of the current item will bound to this character. (so bidirectional relations are recreated).
            item.bindCharacter(this)
        • Throws:
        DeadException - throws this exception when the current character is dead. | isDead()

      • unequip

        public void unequip(int anchorId)
             throws DeadException
        Unequip item on the given slot.
        Parameters:
        anchorId - the anchorId of the item to be unequipped
        Postcondition:
        Unequip the item on the given slot and tries to put it in a backpack when possible otherwise drops it on the ground.
            !(new.hasItem(this.getItemAt(anchorId)))
        Effects:
      • When possible the item will be moved into that backpack.
            for each (Integer key : getAnchorIds())
             if (getItemAt(key).isBackpack() && key != anchorId
             && ((Backpack)getItemAt(key)).canHaveAsItem(item)) then
             item.moveTo((Backpack)getItemAt(key)))
      • When not put in a backpack the item will be dropped on the ground.
            item.drop()
        • Throws:
        DeadException - throws this exception when the current character is dead. | isDead()

      • canPickUp

        @Raw
public boolean canPickUp(Item item)
        Check whether an item can be picked up.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be picked up
        Returns:
        Return false when this character is dead Return false when the holder of the item is not null and not dead. Return false when the new weight of this character will exceed the capacity of this character. Return false when the item is terminated. Return false when the item is already owned by this character. Return true otherwise.
            result == !(isDead()) && !(item.isTerminated()) && !(item.getHolder() == this)   && !(item.getHolder() != null && !item.getHolder().isDead())   && !(this.getCapacity() < this.getTotalWeight() + totalWeightOfItem)

      • pickUp

        public void pickUp(Item item)
            throws DeadException
        Pick up an item from a dead body or from the ground.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be picked up
        Postcondition:
        If this item can not be picked up, nothings happens.
            !canPickUp(item)
        Effects:
      • Otherwise all anchors are checked, if an empty anchor is found and the item can be equipped, the item is equipped there.
            for (int anchorId = 0; anchorId < getNumberOfAnchors(); anchorId ++)
             if (getItemAt(anchorId) == null) then
             this.equip(anchorId, item)
      • If there are no available anchors and there is an anchored backpack that can take this item, then the item will be put in that backpack.
            for (Item itemAt : getAnchoredItems())
             if (itemAt.isBackpack() && ((Backpack)itemAt).canHaveAsItem(item)) then
             item.moveTo((Backpack)itemAt))
        • Throws:
        DeadException - throws this exception when the current character is dead. | isDead()

      • getAnchorIds

        @Raw
public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getAnchorIds()
        Return a set with the ids of all attached anchors.
        Returns:
        Return a set with the ids of all attached anchors.

      • getAnchoredItems

        @Raw
public java.util.Set<Item> getAnchoredItems()
        Return a set with all items anchors attached.
        Returns:
        Return a set with all items anchors attached.

      • getNumberOfAnchors

        @Immutable
 @Basic
public int getNumberOfAnchors()
        Return the number of anchors of this character.
        Returns:
        Return the number of anchors of this character.

      • isValidNumberOfAnchors

        public static boolean isValidNumberOfAnchors(int numberOfAnchors)
        Check whether the given number of anchors is valid.
        Returns:
        Return true when the given number of anchors is positive. Return false otherwise.
            numberOfAnchors >= 0

      • hasProperItems

        @Raw
public boolean hasProperItems()
        Check whether this character has proper items equipped.
        Returns:
        Return true when each item can be equipped at the slot its equipped on and each item has the current character bound Return false otherwise.
             for each (Integer anchorId : getAnchorIds())
             canHaveAsItemAt(anchorId, getItemAt(anchorId)) && getItemAt(anchorId).getCharacter() == this

      • getCapacity

        public abstract float getCapacity()
        Return the character's capacity.
        Returns:
        Return the character's capacity.

      • hit

        public abstract void hit(Character character)
        This character hits the given character.
        Parameters:
        character - the character to hit
        Postcondition:
        This character hits the given character. The new amount of hitpoints of the character is lower or equal than before.
        Throws:
        DeadException - throws this exception when the current character is dead. | isDead()

      • collectTreasures

        public void collectTreasures(Character character)
                      throws DeadException
        This character collects the treasures it wants to take found on a dead character.
        Parameters:
        character - the backpack to look check
        Postcondition:
        Does nothing when the given character is not dead
            !character.isDead()
        Effect:
        All items anchored onto the given dead character will be collected when possible
            for each (Item item : character.getAnchoredItems()) do
             collectTreasure(item);
        Throws:
        DeadException - throws this exception when the current character is dead. | isDead()

      • collectTreasures

        public void collectTreasures(Backpack backpack)
                      throws DeadException
        This character collects the treasures it wants to take found in a backpack.
        Parameters:
        backpack - the backpack to look into
        Postcondition:
        Does nothing when the holder of this backpack is not dead
            !backpack.getHolder().isDead()
        Effect:
        All items in this backpack will be collected when possible
            for (Item item : backpack.getItems()) do
             collectTreasure(item);
        Throws:
        DeadException - throws this exception when the current character is dead. | isDead()

      • collectTreasure

        public abstract void collectTreasure(Item item)
        Pick up the item when this character wants to take it.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to check and pick up
        Effect:
        Pick up the item when this character wants to take it.
            pickUp(item)

      • wantsToTake

        public abstract boolean wantsToTake(Item item)
        Check whether the character wants to take this item.
        Returns:
        Return true if the character wants to take this item. Return false otherwise.

      • getTotalValue

        @Raw
public int getTotalValue()
        Return the total value of this character.
        Returns:
        Return the total value of this character in ducates calculated as the sum of the total values of each anchored item.
            result == sum ({item in getAnchoredItems() :
             if (item.isContainer()) then ((Container)(item)).getTotalValue()
             else item.getValue()
             })

      • getTotalWeight

        @Raw
public float getTotalWeight()
        Return the total weight of this character.
        Returns:
        Return the total weight of this character in kilograms calculated as the sum of the total weights of each anchored item.
            result == sum ({item in getAnchoredItems() :
             if (item.isContainer()) then ((Container)(item)).getTotalWeight()
             else item.getWeight()
             })

      • getBestArmor

        public Armor getBestArmor()
        Return the best armor of any owned armor.
        Returns:
        Return the best armor of any owned armor.
            result.getFullProtection() == max ({item in getAnchoredItems() :
             if (item.isArmor()) then ((Armor)item).getFullProtection()
             else ((Backpack)item).getBestArmor().getFullProtection()
             })
        Note:
        The evaluation of the armor is based on its full protection.

      • getBestWeapon

        public Weapon getBestWeapon()
        Return the best armor of any owned weapon.
        Returns:
        Return the best armor of any owned armor.
            result.getDamage() == max ({item in getAnchoredItems() :
             if (item.isWeapon()) then ((Weapon)item).getDamage()
             else ((Backpack)item).getBestWeapon().getDamage()
             })
        Note:
        The evaluation of the weapon is based on its damage.

      • getBestBackpack

        public Backpack getBestBackpack()
        Return the best backpack of any owned armor.
        Returns:
        Return the best backpack of any owned armor.
            result.getCapacity() == max ({item in getAnchoredItems() :
             if (item.isBackpack()) then
             max ({((Backpack)item).getCapacity(), ((Backpack)item).getBestBackpack().getCapacity()})
             })
        Note:
        The evaluation of the backpack is based on its capacity.

      • giveTo

        public void giveTo(Item item,
                   Character character)
        Try to give an item to the given character.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to give
        character - the character to receive the item
        Postcondition:
        Does nothing when this character is not the holder of this item
            item.getHolder() != this
        Effects:
      • Drop the item so the given character can pick it up.
            item.drop()
      • The given character tries to pick up the dropped item. If the given character cannot pick up the dropped item, this character picks it up again.
            if (character.canPickUp(item)) then character.pickUp(item)
            else this.pickUp(item)
